intro: Iberis reverchonii, commonly known as the alpine candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. The plant is known for its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Iberis reverchonii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
